metadata.label: Condition
metadata.value: A large lacunae in the middle of the left half of the papyrus has damaged the text and on the right side the papyrus fibres are disturbed.

metadata.label: Cutting lines
metadata.value: There are no cutting lines preserved

metadata.label: Complete?
metadata.value: No, the right and bottom sides are broken off. The left side is also broken off, but most of the text can still be read on that side.

metadata.label: Content description
metadata.value:
The letter opens with familiar greetings (ll. 2-3). The sender asks the addressee, who is addressed as "my lord" (ll. 3; 5; 7 sayyidī), for his opinion about what he wrote him (l. 8). The letter ends with familiar greetings (l. 8) and a blessing for the prophet Muḥammad (l. 9)
 
Verso: The letter begins with very short opening blessings for the addressee (l. 3) after which he mentions that the addressee's letter arrived (l. 3). The letter deals further with commercial transactions. The sender mentions that a third person has received all that the addressee owed him of bundles of some produce (l. 4). The sender mentions the possibility that the addressee is in need of something (l. 10) and he asks him to send some people to someone (l. 13)
